Package sportstournament.gui

Class SetupScreen

java.lang.Object
sportstournament.gui.SetupScreen
public class SetupScreen extends Object
This class implements a SetupScreen which prompts the user to enter a team name, select the season length, choose the difficulty and draft a starting team. The user will not be able to start the game until they have finished the setup and met all the requirements.
Author:
Isaac Steele and Reuben Schoonbee

    This method is called once all requirements and conditions are met for the setup and it takes in all selections and passes them to game to handle.

  • Method Details

    • closeWindow

      public void closeWindow()
      Closes the window

    • setupComplete

      public void setupComplete()
      This method is called once all requirements and conditions are met for the setup and it takes in all selections and passes them to game to handle.

    • checkAllSelected

      public boolean checkAllSelected()
      Returns a boolean that depends on whether a set of conditions are met. Used to check if the user input meets the setup requirements.
      Returns:
      true if all conditions are met and false otherwise

    • changeChecker

      public void changeChecker()
      Checks for a change in the selected athletes and updates the draftfunds based on changes made.
